TopicTitle: 100% Stock, fully functional Submarine with transport ship.

Articles.Content:
This is a 100% stock, fully functional submarine. It can reach the deepest corners of Kerbin's sea bed without cheats of any kind. Each engine on the back of the submarine is set to a specific thrust limit to balance the ship, just fire it up and let it go.

It comes with its own transport ship, a beautiful catamaran that can reach speeds over 95 m/s over water. It could go faster, but it will disintegrate if you push it over 100 m/s, that's the resistance limit of the air intakes used as floating devices.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/1Mz7uB9xrFw?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

![Submarine.png](https://lh3.googleusercontent.com/-NwqYiZE1oD8/VRWCzL70ZMI/AAAAAAAAAxM/O3PmpAEnz4k/w1118-h631-no/Submarine.png)

To download this ship please follow this link: [https://www.dropbox.com/s/syt1zanq5y3rou6/Submarine%20XVIII.craft?dl=0](https://www.dropbox.com/s/syt1zanq5y3rou6/Submarine%20XVIII.craft?dl=0)

This submarine was designed for a challenge on the forums, the challenge specified that the submarine needed a Claw to attach itself to the ocean floor. Of course the claw won't work on Kerbin's surface, but I added it anyway just to comply with the rules. If you want to substitute the claw inside the cargo bay behind the cockpit with another fuel thank, just go ahead.

Link to the challenge: [http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/113743-Deep-Diver-Challenge%21](https://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/113743-Deep-Diver-Challenge%21)

If you manage to do something cool with it, please share it here.

One does not simply submarine.

But Wookie can! 10/10 would sink in it again.

> 
> One does not simply submarine.
> But Wookie can! 10/10 would sink in it again.

This is the first time I've designed a ship in which sinking is a desirable feature.

This is awesome. Wooks you amaze as always. 

I foresee this starting an underwater arms race in the military threads ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Finally we can make stock Nuclear subs all thanks to Wooks
Okay, who is going to make a flying submarine which is also a rover?

> 
> Okay, who is going to make a flying submarine which is also a rover?

Alright, lets see what I can do....

Well, I just found out that submarines as it turns out, are really easy to make.... Here is the SuperNut 1 (Don't know where the SuperNut came from, maybe because the idea of a flying submarine rover is super nuts?). After you wait for the engines to spool up, it manages a rather nice 8 or so m/s downwards. I use Stock Revamp for the graphics, but besides that its 100% stock

.![3RXqj4e.png](http://i.imgur.com/3RXqj4e.png)'

![Uk1f6nJ.png](http://i.imgur.com/Uk1f6nJ.png)

![cQtWgnI.png](http://i.imgur.com/cQtWgnI.png)

Right now, the only way to actually get it to the water is with HyperEdit... SuperNut 1.1 is going to get that 'rover' part of the project done. SuperNut 1.2 should then be a submarine plane rover, and finally SuperNut 1.3 should be a more refined version for public release. That is of course, assuming that I don't go nuts (Pun intended) trying to get SuperNut 1.2 working.

The easy part is out of the way, now the hard part. 

Once I add wings to this sucker, I have a really bad feeling Im gonna get a case of moar boosters.

we have all tried that at the RB section but to no avail- it's too slow once underwater about 3-4 m/s and missiles are too part heavy to sink down with reasonable number of engines. maybe when the new cargo bay module comes out we could do that if it will also shield from water physics but i doubt it

> 
> Here is the SuperNut 1 (Don't know where the SuperNut came from, maybe because the idea of a flying submarine rover is super nuts?). After you wait for the engines to spool up, it manages a rather nice 8 or so m/s downwards.

Cool one, it will fit inside the cargo bay of my Executor Class Submarine, right in front of the ballistic missiles bay. Care to share the download link?

> 
> we have all tried that at the RB section but to no avail- it's too slow once underwater about 3-4 m/s and missiles are too part heavy to sink down with reasonable number of engines. maybe when the new cargo bay module comes out we could do that if it will also shield from water physics but i doubt it

It can be done, but the level of dificulty increases exponentially:

*WIP, still working on balance and buoyancy, and later on aesthetics.*

![Untitled.png](https://lh6.googleusercontent.com/-noD-KJaIeXg/VRle1UEpVuI/AAAAAAAAAys/cSQ4V2d56vk/w1118-h629-no/Untitled.png)

Still working in efficiency issues, this monster eats fuel like there is no tomorrow because air breathing engines won't cut it for the size of this thing. Speed of travel over and under water is a serious issue but I believe is possible to do something about it.

We never weld parts. No mods of any sort are tolerated.

And those were not concept ships. They were fully deployed.
so there are no parts at all in KSP that are denser than water?
